events.originalText: The Helsinki Agreement between the Free Aceh Movement and the Government of Indonesia was signed, ending more than 28 years of fighting.
events.subtitle: Free Aceh Movement
events.headline: Helsinki Agreement signed, ending 28 years of fighting in Aceh, Indonesia

events.originalText: The Troubles: A car bomb attack carried out by the Real Irish Republican Army killed 29 people and injured approximately 220 others in Omagh, Northern Ireland.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: Car bomb attack in Omagh, Northern Ireland kills 29 and injures 220

events.originalText: Big Ear, a radio telescope at Ohio State University received a strong, apparently extraterrestrial radio signal that became known as the Wow! signal.
events.subtitle: Ohio State University Radio Observatory
events.headline: Ohio State University's Big Ear telescope receives extraterrestrial radio signal

events.originalText: Mid-ranking army officers overthrew Bangladesh's founding leader, Sheikh Mujibur Rahman (pictured), killing him and most of his family.
events.subtitle: 15 August 1975 Bangladeshi coup d'état
events.headline: Bangladesh's founding leader Sheikh Mujibur Rahman overthrown and killed by army officers

events.originalText: President Fulbert Youlou was overthrown in the Republic of Congo, after a three-day uprising in the capital.
events.subtitle: Fulbert Youlou
events.headline: President Fulbert Youlou ousted in Republic of Congo uprising

events.originalText: The Republic of Korea was established with Syngman Rhee (pictured) as its first president.
events.subtitle: History of South Korea
events.headline: Republic of Korea established with Syngman Rhee as first president

events.originalText: Jawaharlal Nehru (pictured) took office as the first prime minister of India, a post he held for 16 years.
events.subtitle: Jawaharlal Nehru
events.headline: Jawaharlal Nehru becomes India's first prime minister

events.originalText: World War II: Allied forces began their invasion of southern France.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Allied forces begin invasion of southern France in World War II

events.originalText: World War II: The tanker SS Ohio reached Malta as part of an operation to deliver much-needed supplies during the siege of Malta.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Tanker SS Ohio delivers supplies to Malta during siege

events.originalText: Josef Jakobs, a German spy, became the last person executed at the Tower of London.
events.subtitle: Josef Jakobs
events.headline: German spy Josef Jakobs executed at Tower of London

events.originalText: A military coup against the government of Dimitrios Rallis began in the neighbourhood of Goudi in Athens, Greece.
events.subtitle: Goudi coup
events.headline: Military coup against Dimitrios Rallis government begins in Athens

events.originalText: War of 1812: Potawatomi warriors ambushed a United States Army convoy after it had evacuated Fort Dearborn, in present-day Chicago, and razed the fort.
events.subtitle: War of 1812
events.headline: Potawatomi warriors ambush US Army convoy after Fort Dearborn evacuation

events.originalText: Byzantine–Ottoman wars: The Empire of Trebizond, the longest-surviving Byzantine successor state, was conquered by Ottoman forces following a month-long siege.
events.subtitle: Byzantine–Ottoman wars
events.headline: Empire of Trebizond conquered by Ottoman forces after month-long siege

events.originalText: Michael VIII Palaiologos was crowned Byzantine emperor in Constantinople.
events.subtitle: Michael VIII Palaiologos
events.headline: Michael VIII Palaiologos crowned Byzantine emperor in Constantinople

events.originalText: Upon the death of his uncle Stephen I, Peter became the second king of Hungary.
events.subtitle: Stephen I of Hungary
events.headline: Peter becomes second king of Hungary after uncle Stephen I's death

events.originalText: Byzantine general Eustathios Daphnomeles captured and blinded Ibatzes of Bulgaria by means of a ruse, ending the last resistance against Emperor Basil II's conquest of Bulgaria.
events.subtitle: Eustathios Daphnomeles
events.headline: Byzantine general captures and blinds Ibatzes of Bulgaria, ending resistance

events.originalText: Forces of the Umayyad Caliphate abandoned their year-long siege of Constantinople, ending the Umayyad goal of conquering the Byzantine Empire.
events.subtitle: Umayyad Caliphate
events.headline: Umayyad Caliphate forces abandon year-long siege of Constantinople
